articles.headline: ‘We Need to Oppose Russia’: Ukrainians Find Common Purpose
articles.snippet: A trip along the Dnieper River explores what it means to be Ukrainian at a moment of extreme peril, as the country debates Russia’s place in its past, and its future.
articles.abstract: A trip along the Dnieper River explores what it means to be Ukrainian at a moment of extreme peril, as the country debates Russia’s place in its past, and its future.
articles.lead_paragraph: ALONG THE DNIEPER RIVER, Ukraine — Fishing on a marbled expanse of frozen river, dressed head to toe in camouflage, Viktor Berkut looked very much the Soviet-born Everyman, and has the biography to match. He joined the Red Army in 1970 and spent three decades building air defense and rocket systems directed against Moscow’s ideological enemies in the West.
articles.byline: By Michael Schwirtz and Brendan Hoffman

articles.headline: Tone of Ukraine Crisis Shifts as Russia Signals Openness to Talk More
articles.snippet: Diplomacy is “far from exhausted,” Russia’s foreign minister said, while President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said the prospect of his country joining NATO might be just a “dream.”
articles.abstract: Diplomacy is “far from exhausted,” Russia’s foreign minister said, while President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said the prospect of his country joining NATO might be just a “dream.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow the latest news on Ukraine and Russia.
articles.byline: By Anton Troianovski and Andrew E. Kramer

articles.headline: Baffled by the Chaos in Canada? So Are Canadians.
articles.snippet: The protests seem to challenge the cherished image that Canadians are moderate, rule-following and just plain nice. But was that really a myth all along?
articles.abstract: The protests seem to challenge the cherished image that Canadians are moderate, rule-following and just plain nice. But was that really a myth all along?
articles.lead_paragraph: [Follow our live coverage of the Ottawa Protests.]

articles.headline: How Josh Mandel, Son of Suburban Ohio, Became a Right-Wing Warrior
articles.snippet: The Senate candidate was a rising Republican when he abandoned his moderate roots. Now, those who have watched his transformation wonder if his rhetoric reflects who he really is.
articles.abstract: The Senate candidate was a rising Republican when he abandoned his moderate roots. Now, those who have watched his transformation wonder if his rhetoric reflects who he really is.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEACHWOOD, Ohio — In the fall of 2016, Donald J. Trump’s presidential campaign was pressing Ohio’s young state treasurer, Josh Mandel, to step it up. A former Marine, he held some sway with Republican voters, and Trump aides wanted him doing more public events.
articles.byline: By Jennifer Medina and Lisa Lerer

articles.headline: Who Is the Real China? Eileen Gu or the Chained Woman?
articles.snippet: The women’s starkly different circumstances — celebrated vs. silenced — reflect that to the Chinese state everyone is a tool that serves a purpose until it does not.
articles.abstract: The women’s starkly different circumstances — celebrated vs. silenced — reflect that to the Chinese state everyone is a tool that serves a purpose until it does not.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two women have dominated Chinese social media during the Beijing Winter Olympics.

articles.headline: With Indoor Ski Resorts and Curling Schools, China Lifts Xi’s Sports Dream
articles.snippet: China said it succeeded on a vow by Xi Jinping, the country’s top leader, to nurture millions of winter sports enthusiasts. But will the interest last after the Winter Games end?
articles.abstract: China said it succeeded on a vow by Xi Jinping, the country’s top leader, to nurture millions of winter sports enthusiasts. But will the interest last after the Winter Games end?
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow our latest coverage of the 2022 Winter Olympics.

articles.headline: Sarah Palin’s Libel Claim Against The Times Is Rejected by a Jury
articles.snippet: The verdict came a day after the judge said he planned to dismiss the case, ruling that Ms. Palin’s legal team had failed to prove that the newspaper defamed her.
articles.abstract: The verdict came a day after the judge said he planned to dismiss the case, ruling that Ms. Palin’s legal team had failed to prove that the newspaper defamed her.
articles.lead_paragraph: A jury rejected Sarah Palin’s libel suit against The New York Times on Tuesday, a day after the judge said he would dismiss the case if the jury ruled in her favor because her legal team had failed to provide sufficient evidence that she had been defamed by a 2017 editorial erroneously linking her to a mass shooting.
